info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 24 at 11:24AM MST until December 25 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph, with localized gusts up to 90 mph possible in wind prone locations along the immediate eastern slopes of the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHERE...Southern Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains, and Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera. * WHEN...Until Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, while drifting snow could lead to complete lane blockages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition, some light rain may fall Saturday evening. While air temperatures may be above freezing, rain may still freeze on contact with the frozen ground.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
